ygData.subject: Re: My wishlist on the interface
ygData.msgSnippet: Prior to 12th level I used it for luring only.  I figured the 1 or 2 silver wasted on a throwing knife was worth it, esp in crowded zones like Crushbone and
ygData.messageBody:
Prior to 12th level I used it for luring only. I figured the 1 or 2 silver
wasted on a throwing knife was worth it, esp in crowded zones like Crushbone
and Greater Feydark.

Rokenn Swiftsong - Karana server
Master Brewer of Societus Argenti
Amerginn - Test server


>From: "Andy Simpson" <gohorns@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] My wishlist on the interface
>Date: Wed, 8 Jul 1998 16:25:25 -0500
>
>From: "Andy Simpson" <gohorns@...>
>
>
>
> > 2. Perhaps there is a way - and I just missed it, do we ever get to
>weild
> > one weapon and an instrument? I could have sworn I saw a higher
> > level bard
> > doing just this once, but could never get it to equip. I figured
> > I might be
> > able to do this once I got dual wield, but if there is one that lets us
>do
> > it, I've not found it yet.
>
>I used to get questions about this all the time when I carried a mino axe
>and a drum or mandolin. You CAN carry a weapon and an instrument at the
>same time, the problem is you can't use the weapon in a conventional way.
>Before I got dual wield I would put my mino axe in my range weapon slot and
>my intrument in my secondary mellee slot. This gave the appearance that I
>was carrying a weapon and an instrument. Too bad the only way I could use
>the weapon would be to throw it at that point.
>
>On a related note, have any of you bards used throwing skill at all? I've
>found it to be a collosal waste of money so far, but maybe I am doing it
>wrong. :)
>
>
